Contradict fact: The claim contradicts the fact that the video shows Typhoon Hagibis hitting Japan when it actually shows Typhoon Mangkhut hitting Hong Kong.
Lack enough support: The claim lacks enough support as it is based on a misleading video that is not related to Typhoon Hagibis.
Problematic assumption: The claim assumes that the video accurately depicts Typhoon Hagibis hitting Japan, which is not the case.
Exist alternative explanation: The alternative explanation is that the video actually shows Typhoon Mangkhut hitting Hong Kong, as supported by evidence from a Hong Kong-based social media site and Chinese video site.
Understate: There is no evidence of understating in the claim.
Exaggerate: There is no evidence of exaggeration in the claim.
Falters at times: The claim falters at times by misidentifying the typhoon in the video and attributing it to Typhoon Hagibis instead of Typhoon Mangkhut.
